pages.text: The Magic of the Wilds exists in all natural places and things, and that magic can be harnessed for great works.$(br2)Once, those who channeled this power were called Druids and guarded their knowledge jealously. I will detail their decline and fading $(l:concepts/wild_magic)elsewhere$() in this tome.$(br2)The existence of this tome and the spells, rituals and

crafts contained herein is owed entirely to these Druids, though exposing such mysteries openly would not be appreciated by them.$(br2)Nonetheless, this is precisely what I shall do.$(br2)Contained within are $(cat:concepts)historical and conceptual works$() of note, as well as, $(cat:crafting)crafting recipes and rituals$(), techniques for $(cat:herbs)herbalism$() and, most importantly, $(cat:spells)spell craft$().$(br2)Each section contains its own

introduction, which should be enough to acquaint the beginner in the fundamentals.$(br2)Many secrets were lost to the Fading, but I am certain that what is presented herein shall prove a boon to anyone willing to embrace the Wilds.$(br2)- Iselius Thorn
